title: Torque - forces on a rotating wheel

content.question: Two blocks of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are connected by a thin string that passes over a circular wheel of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, as shown. The wheel is attached to a vertical stand and rotates freely about its center. The string does not slip on the wheel and exerts forces <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on the blocks. When the wheel is released from rest in the position shown, it undergoes an angular acceleration and rotates clockwise. Which of the following statements about the magnitudes of <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is correct?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub 1 equals T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because the tension in the string must always be constant within the string.

<math alttext="T sub 1 equals T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because both blocks have the same acceleration.

<math alttext="T sub 1 is less than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is farther from the wheel than <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1 is less than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because an unbalanced clockwise torque is needed to accelerate the wheel clockwise.

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 1 is less than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> because an unbalanced clockwise torque is needed to accelerate the wheel clockwise.
